quest.name: Into the Deltascape
journal: Cid is eager to proceed with the investigation.

For want of a better option, you agree to do as Omega bade you and engage the test subjects inside the Deltascape. While you do battle within, your comrades will provide support without. You will not be entirely alone in there, however; as you will need to make use of Alpha's “existential authorization,” he will go with you into the test world.

※In the event that you leave the Interdimensional Rift, you may re-enter by speaking with the Ironworks hand at the Yawn.

Alpha stands ready to enter the Deltascape, and the portal beckons. If you have any final preparations, now would be the time to see to them.

※Deltascape V1.0 can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
Inside the Deltascape, you come face-to-face with Alte Roite. The winged serpent falls upon you with a vengeance, but you stand your ground and ultimately emerge the victor.

Outside the Deltascape, your comrades compliment you on a battle well won. When Nero subsequently questions Omega's apparent obsession with determining the strongest being, Midgardsormr appears and explains that, having defeated Shinryu, it now seeks to create a mightier foe to fight. Fearing that the violence of such an encounter would be akin to another calamity, Cid is determined to stop Omega's plan. He duly grants Biggs and Wedge leave to investigate the stasis system in Carteneau, while he and Nero remain in the rift to aid you in the tests to come.

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kweh?

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Quite impressive for an improvised arrangement, even if I do say so myself. Now then, let us see what we can learn from our host's many monitors.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: I was thinking about asking the crew to throw some supplies in after us. But only the gods know if they'd make it here in one piece. You can bet they wouldn't be the right way up if they did, though.

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: Whew... All that jumping and fading and fighting really took it out of me...

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text:
What I need now is a steaming-hot cup of tea...and nothing makes a better brew than the Mark XIV Thermocoil Boilmaster, coming soon to a Garlond Ironworks-approved vendor near you!
...S-Sorry. Jessie made me do it.

dialogue.name: GARLONDGATEKEEPER
dialogue.text: Good eveningmorrowday to you, madamsir. Will you be descending into the Yawn?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Enter the Interdimensional Rift?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Right then, what to do next...

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: We know that Omega is conducting tests to determine the strongest being.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: But we do not know its ultimate purpose, nor even its exact whereabouts.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Plainly, however, it is within Omega's power to curtail our stay here whensoever it chooses. Accordingly, we have little choice but to proceed as bidden and defeat the test subjects waiting in the Deltascape.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Well, Alpha certainly seems keen. Though it might be best if you left the fighting to others, little one.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: That is, of course, assuming “others” are willing? What say you, old friend?

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: This promises to be a most entertaining foray, and I would not dream of missing any part of it. You may rely on me to provide you with remote support.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: With commendable foresight, I took the liberty of borrowing the various monitors that were lying around, and shall extract all the information I can from them.

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kweh! Kweh!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Hmph. 'Tis a pity none of us speaks chocobo. As I recall, though, we are supposed to have Alpha transfer his authorization to us prior to engaging in combat.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: In which case, Forename, you'll need him to accompany you into the Deltascape. See to your preparations, and proceed whenever you are ready.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: At this point, we're doing little more than fumbling in the dark. Take care in there, you hear?

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Well, then! Let the inquisition begin.

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kweh! Kweh!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Alpha appears eager to proceed. You may enter Deltascape V1.0 whenever you are ready.

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: Kweh! Kweh!

dialogue.name: ALPHA
dialogue.text: K-Kweh!

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Well, well, aren't we in fine form?

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: Nice work in there, Forename. As you can see, we've finished setting up here. Now we've got everything straight, we'll do our best to make ourselves useful. If you need anything, just ask, eh?

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: I'm glad you're safe, you and Alpha both!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Well done, my friend! We were lucky enough to witness every moment of your struggle via the Deltascape's various surveillance devices. I daresay we had a better view than you did.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Gaining control over them was the extent of our accomplishments for this outing─though I suppose we did also learn your adversary's name. Rest assured, however, that there will be plenty more such outings.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Preliminary analysis suggests that there are four combatants in the Deltascape all told, including your friend Alte Roite. Which means you will be required to win three further bouts─with Deltas II to IV─in this test world alone.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Needless to say, there are plenty more such worlds in the rift, holding the remaining eighty-five subjects between them.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Plainly, our host has gone to no small amount of trouble. Quite why it is so obsessed with determining the strongest being is another question.

dialogue.name: MIDGARDSORMR
dialogue.text: Omega seeketh to improve itself. To evolve. This was ever its primary directive. Through contending with mighty foes, it groweth stronger.

dialogue.name: MIDGARDSORMR
dialogue.text: Having vanquished the vile simulacrum you call Shinryu, a greater adversary was needed. In the absence of such a being, it had but to create one.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: So in the name of self-improvement, it wants to make a new playmate... And it chose to undertake the task here to avoid outside interference, yes?

dialogue.name: MIDGARDSORMR
dialogue.text: ...In part. The making of life is not Omega's primary function. It bringeth complex beings into the corporeal realm only at great cost to itself.

dialogue.name: MIDGARDSORMR
dialogue.text: As such, it employeth this plane to test unfinished works, that it might determine a single entity worthy of creation.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: If I understand you correctly, the moment Omega's grand experiment is complete, it will give birth to a creature mightier even than Shinryu and then proceed to fight it.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Gods help us all if a battle of that scale should come to pass. The powers unleashed would be enough to bring about another calamity.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Hm. Assuming the dragon has the right of it, all test subjects must needs be works in progress─save for ourselves, of course. But how then do we explain Alpha? As I recall, it manifested corporeally outside the rift.

dialogue.name: NERO
dialogue.text: Then again...it is hardly the most complex of creatures. Mayhap it was finished by accident.

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: Don't you make fun of Alpha! He's a good boy, and if it hadn't been for him, we would all have been erased! He might not be strong, but he's brave! And reliable! And adorable!

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: Er...changing the subject for a moment, Chief─after you lost track of Omega, you said you reengaged its stasis systems, right?

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: ...Meaning something somewhere isn't working like it should.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: I only ask 'cause me and Wedge have done pretty much all we can here, and were wondering if it might be worth going to Carteneau to look into it.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: That would be a great help. Nero and I can handle things at this end.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: We'll be off, then. Don't do anything I wouldn't do, eh?

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: And you be a good boy, Alpha. Do as you're told, and look after Forename for me!
